meanings.definition: Not supported by evidence or authority.
meanings.sent1: The unbacked claim was quickly dismissed by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her unbacked theory lacked credibility among the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The unbacked story about aliens visiting Earth made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His unbacked promise to always be on time fell apart within a week.
meanings.sent5: The unbacked accusation left a cloud of doubt hanging over the suspect.

meanings.definition: Not having a backing or support.
meanings.sent1: The unbacked chair collapsed under his weight.
meanings.sent2: The unbacked wall started to crumble in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The unbacked plan to build a treehouse without nails seemed impossible.
meanings.sent4: Her unbacked decision to quit her job without a backup plan backfired.
meanings.sent5: The unbacked bridge swayed dangerously in the wind.

meanings.definition: Not having financial backing or support.
meanings.sent1: The unbacked startup struggled to attract investors.
meanings.sent2: She had to abandon the unbacked project due to lack of funds.
meanings.sent3: The unbacked business idea seemed risky but exciting.
meanings.sent4: Their unbacked venture into the market proved to be a costly mistake.
meanings.sent5: The unbacked charity event failed to raise enough donations.
